Citta    Film and Television majors register for H56.0045.001 (Call # 70704) UG non-majors register for H56.0045.002 (Call # 70705)    Wednesday, 2:00 - 4:45 pm (with a scheduled break)                                           Audiences  view films in many different ways with methods of delivery constantly changing;  DVD, handheld  devices, streaming video, and various web transmission types to name a few.  This craft production  course enables the student to prepare their reel, film or portfolio for  delivery via different means, presenting it in a well designed context.  Students will have their own website for their  reel along with a DVD containing  optimal resolution of their work. Main areas of concentration are the design  and technique of video delivery via web and DVD,  as well as reformatting  video for the smaller screen. Topics covered are project planning (target  audience definition,  the flow chart), compression and encoding video for online and DVD viewing, still/motion  menu page creation/editing, graphical and navigational design, audio/video  design, and  overall website and DVD authoring  issues. Students will work with Final Cut Pro, Dreamweaver, DVD  Studio Pro, Toast, and Photoshop. Please not there is a non-refundable lab fee for this course, to be  announced. Some previous experience and comfort with multi media computer programs  recommended, as well as basic knowledge of Mac OS.         There is a non-refundable fee for this course. Fee TBA.
